result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian P. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with J.G.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to County Jail

03:18 PM 15CM249 & 15CM372. Defendant Brian P. Johnson in court with attorney Angela Wang.  Defendant Brian P. Johnson in custody.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant on both matters received. No clarifications or corrections. Joint recommendation stated by DA Leusink. 15CM372-6 months WCJ, with Good Time Credit and credit for 88 days Time Served. Consecutive to any sentence being served. 15CM249- 3 months WCJ, Consecutive to 15CM372, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Costs have been reduced to collections. Appeal Rights Given.
by USPS - DE no longer at MSDF
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 22, 2021 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 26, 2021 at 11:00 am.

11:31 AM 15CM249 & 15CM372- Defendant Brian P. Johnson in court, by phone with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Barry J Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over status of matter and questions defendant regarding waiver of personal appearance. Defendant waives appearance. Sentencing argument by ADA Braatz. Sentencing argument by Attorney Patzer. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 7 days WCJ, with Credit for 7 days.  No Contact with J.G. AODA and follow through. Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed-Court directs to be provided by November 1, 2019. Expungement of DNA through DOJ. Appeal Rights Given to Attorney Patzer.

Sentencing hearing on September 20, 2019 at 11:30 am.
from Attorney Patzer requesting a different date - Granted by the Court

15CM249 & 15CM372 Cases called @ 11:42 AM Defendant Brian P. Johnson in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Brian P. Johnson in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court withdraws the warrants previously issued. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CM249: Ct 1 - NC. 15CM372: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM249: Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. The Court adjourns sentencing at the request of the parties. Court orders the signature bond previously imposed be reinstated to also include Case No. 15CM372.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Voluntary appearance on August 1, 2019 at 11:30 am.

Case called @ 1:33 p.m. Defendant Brian P. Johnson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:25 am.
